modName: snowy windhelm a simple texture ground edit without an esp WIP
summary:
parallax, hand paint, vanilla, 2k, multilayer parallax
2.2 fixed performance in market with parallax mesh, unified files' structure so made it easier to avoid leftovers.
descriptionHtml:
Vanilla ground textures for Windhelm are of one of the ugliest in the entire game, they are brown, repetitive and not realistic at all -

Windhelm is supposed to be snowy and frozen. To fix this there have been several esp mods that add snow layer to the ground.  However, I came up with
a texture tweak that doesn't burden your load order. 
Covered 2 different snow covers in both quarters of the city, street stones and stairs, no parallax, but normal, specular, diffuse 
1.9 onward multilayering the original mod (adding some chaos so there is no repetition), experimenting, hv fun!

DO IT YOURSELF! : download paint.net take whroughground.dds and whroughgroundmud.dds

(folder: C:\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim\Data\Textures\architecture\windhelm)

select invert colors, then edit contrast/brightness to be less. This is already enough for snow cover, no need fancy. Save as DTX1 whroughground and DTX5 whroughgroundmud

this mod uses mainly vanilla assets as set to be
=======================================================================

UV tweaks also costs no perfomance and I highly recommend that mod.  http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74324/?

=======================================================================

MODS THAT YOU CAN SEE IN THE PICTURE:

meshes by Enhaced texture detail UV tweaks for Windhelm by somerandomguy (there are no better meshes for Windhelm, amen), clutter/items/flora by renthal331, trees by david (trees mod), snowy AF windhelm diffuse elements mixed in (upper part of the city), skysan icicles with mindlux ice patch, JK Windhelm. 


 my logos (for modder Renthal) for fun, just having a laugh with paint.net (I love that program, but no options so alot is handpainted like lights):

my ''edits'' and small modifications end 2016:
Lucid's realistic preset:   you can find on thelazy and here, adds dark dungeons/nights to enderal and does what the mod titles says
Player background:   adds users' wallpapers and a randomizer, available on Nexus
author: Lucidstorm1
